Method Detail

loadPersistentEntity

public static Object loadPersistentEntity(org.hibernate.SessionFactory sessionFactory,
                                          Class clazz,
                                          Long id)
Loads an object by given class and id. Wraps any exceptions in a RepositoryObjectNotFoundException in order to reduce tight coupling with Hibernate

Parameters:
clazz - - the class of the desired object
id - - the identifier of desired object
Throws:
RepositoryObjectNotFoundException - if object not found

getPersistentEntity

public static Object getPersistentEntity(org.hibernate.SessionFactory sessionFactory,
                                         Class clazz,
                                         Long id)
Gets an object by given class and id. Unlike load(), a get() will return null if the object can't be found.

Parameters:
clazz - - the class of the desired object
id - - the identifier of desired object
Returns:
the entity object identified by given id, or null if not found

manuallyBindHibernateSessionToThreadLocal

public static void manuallyBindHibernateSessionToThreadLocal(org.hibernate.SessionFactory sessionFactory)
Bind a session to ThreadLocal for use by this thread. Note Spring MVC Framework will normally do this automatically. This method exists so it can be used in contexts outside Spring (such as unit tests, command-line java applications, etc)

getHibernateSession

public static org.hibernate.Session getHibernateSession(org.hibernate.SessionFactory sessionFactory)
Centralized method for accessing current hibernate session

Parameters:
sessionFactory -
Returns:

manuallyUnBindHibernateSessionFromThreadLocal

public static void manuallyUnBindHibernateSessionFromThreadLocal(org.hibernate.SessionFactory sessionFactory)
Unbind session from ThreadLocal and release session. Note Spring MVC Framework will normally do this automatically. This method exists so it can be used in contexts outside Spring (such as unit tests, command-line java applications, etc)

flush

public static void flush(org.hibernate.SessionFactory sessionFactory)
Flush the current hibernate session (issue queries to update database with changes). Note: Consider moving flush to the end of OpenSessionInView to speed things up and reduce number of flushes
